The mime type of your content. Corresponds to the ad copy type in Broadsign Control Administrator:  
* Standard ad copy: `jpg`; `png`; `mp4`; etc.  
* Creator ad copy: `x-creator`  
* External source ad copy: (mime type will be blank; size will read "-1")  
* Ticker ad copy: `x-ticker`  
* Web redirect ad copy: `html`  
* HTML package: `x-html-package`  
* Application ad copy: `zip`  
* Video capture ad copy: `x-video-capture`

info.description:
The console below provides you with all endpoints and parameters available for BroadSign's REST API. We use HTTP verbs, token authentication and HTTP response codes to assist with your integration. Our REST API maps onto the products found in [BroadSign Control](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/broadsign-control-products/).  
  
 For security reasons, you are unable to directly connect to BroadSign Server from this console. However, you can enter an HTTP Token or Public Key Fingerprint (see [Authentication](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/authentication-rest.html)) and generate a sample request and response.  
  
 *Note:* BroadSign provides a second endpoint for testing your integration: `https://api-sandbox.broadsign.com`   
  
 For a broader introduction to our REST API, see [Getting Started](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/getting-started-rest.html).

put.description: Updates the details of an existing [bundle](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/bundles.html) on your domain.

active.description: Indicates whether or not the resource is active.

allow_custom_duration.description: Indicates whether or not you want to allow custom duration of the bundle.

attributes.description: The bundle's attributes. Use this parameter to specify non-fullscreen, custom geometry. If you use this it, set the `fullscreen` parameter to *false*.

auto_synchronized.description: Indicates whether or not the bundle will auto-synchronize.

category_id.description: The unique ID# of the separation [category](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/categories-and-triggers.html) associated with the bundle.

domain_id.description: The unique ID# of your domain.

fullscreen.description: Indicates whether or not the bundle will appear fullscreen. *Note:* This is a custom geometry shortcut that avoids having to specify the exact screen dimensions. If you use this option, you can leave the `attributes` parameter unspecified.

id.description: The unique ID# of the resource.

interactivity_timeout.description: The amount of time to elapse on an interactive display before a timeout occurs. See [Interactive Campaigns](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/interactive-campaigns.html).

loop_category_id.description: The unique ID# of the segmentation category associated with the bundle.

loop_positions.description: The position of the bundle in its loop. See [Absolute Ordering Behaviour](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/manual-loop-adjustments.html).

loop_weight.description: The weight of the segmentation category associated with the bundle.

max_duration_msec.description: The maximum duration of the bundle in milliseconds.

position.description: The bundle's position in the loop.

secondary_sep_category_ids.description: The unique ID# or ID#s of the secondary separation categories associated with the bundle. Used with the [Share of Loop](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/share-of-loop.html) feature.

get.description:
Lists the contents of specific [folders](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/resources.html) on your domain.  
 **Note:** Do not confuse scoping as we use the term in Broadsign Control Administrator, with scoping as we use the term in BroadSign Open.  
 In Broadsign Control Administrator, scoping describes the limiting of what users can see (see Network Operations  Scoping).  
 In BroadSign Open, scoping describes the narrowing of results of certain list operations.

post.description:
Adds a [piece of content (ad copy)](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/ad-copies.html) to your domain.  

 Sample request:  
```  
Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=[boundary]  
Content-Length: [totalSizeOfMultiPartBody]  
\r\n  
--[boundary]  
\r\n  
{  
	"domain_id": "did",  
	"name": "contentName",  
	"originalFileName": "fileName",  
	"container_id": "cid",  
	"size": "fileSizeInBytes",  
	"parent_id": "pid",  
	"attributes": "attributes",  
	"mime" : "mime"  
}  
\r\n  
--[boundary]  
\r\n  
[file]  
```

attributes.description:
Information on the file, which will vary according to **mime** type. See [Mime Types and Attributes](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/mime-types-attributes.html).  
 **Note:** Use newline separators between items in the string.

bmb_host_id.description: The unique ID# of the player resource used to fetch [BroadSign Creator content](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/broadsign-creator-content.html), if applicable.

container_id.description: The unique ID# of the resource folder.

domain_id.description: The unique ID# of your domain.

feeds.description: The source of any external feeds (e.g., Twitter).

mime.description:
The mime type of your content. Corresponds to the ad copy type in Broadsign Control Administrator:  
* Standard ad copy: `jpg`; `png`; `mp4`; etc.  
* Creator ad copy: `x-creator`  
* External source ad copy: (mime type will be blank; size will read "-1")  
* Ticker ad copy: `x-ticker`  
* Web redirect ad copy: `html`  
* HTML package: `x-html-package`  
* Application ad copy: `zip`  
* Video capture ad copy: `x-video-capture`

originalfilename.description: The name of the original file.

parent_id.description: The unique ID# of the content's bundle.

size.description: The size of the file ('M', 'K' or 'Bytes').

id.description: Description for property. ResourceId

* 2 = Decrement screen count

* 0 = Serial

* 2 = TCP (specific)  
* 65535 = Unknown

drain_bytes.description: Some displays will periodically fill an RS-232 command buffer with unwanted garbage bytes that need to be cleaned out. By specifying a certain amount of bytes to drain, BroadSign Player will read up to that many bytes from the screen and discard the result, creating a clean command buffer to retry the operation.

put.description: Updates the details of an existing [display unit](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/display-units.html) on your domain.

active.description: Indicates whether or not the resource is active.

address.description: The physical address of the display unit (e.g., 1100 Boulevard Robert-Bourassa, Montreal, QC H3B 3A5).

bmb_host_id.description: The unique ID# of the player resource used to fetch [BroadSign Creator content](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/broadsign-creator-content.html), if applicable.

container_id.description: The unique ID# of the resource folder.

domain_id.description: The unique ID# of your domain.

enforce_day_parts.description: Indicates whether or not [day part](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/day-parts.html) enforcement is active.

enforce_screen_controls.description: Indicates whether or not [screen control](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/display-units.htmlscreen-control) enforcement is active. If toggled to `true` (i.e., `on`), it activates the `Suspend/Resume screen according to opening hours` feature. See [Day Parts - Opening Hours](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/day-parts.html).

export_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not export is enabled.

external_id.description: Use this field to store an external identifier for the [display unit](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/display-units.html) in other systems. BroadSign Player writes the external ID in its share directory in a file named `display_unit_external_id.txt`. Third party applications, or Flash content, can then read the file.

geolocation.description: The latitudinal and longitudinal data of the display unit.

* 2 = Display device error  
* 3 = Display not fullscreen  
* 4 = Display resolution mismatch  
* 5 = Display temperature warning  
* 6 = Display temperature critical  
* 7 = Display orientation mismatch  
* 103 = Playback error  
* 104 = Playback missing file  
* 105 = Playback truncated file  
* 106 = Playback disk space  
* 107 = Playback expired file  
* 205 = Host/player MIA  
* 206 = Host/player difficulties polling  
* 207 = Host/player performance problem  
* 208 = Host/player application fault  
* 209 = Host/player memory exhausted  
* 210 = Host/player deadlock  
* 211 = Host/player offline during business hours  
* 212 = Host/player URL sync failed  
* 213 = Host/player backup master activated

put.description: Updates an existing [campaign](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/campaigns.html) on your domain.

active.description: Indicates whether or not the resource is active.

auto_synchronize_bundles.description: Indicates whether or not the [player](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/players.html) will synchronize [bundles](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/bundles.html) automatically.

bmb_host_id.description: The unique ID# of the player resource used to fetch [BroadSign Creator content](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/broadsign-creator-content.html), if applicable.

container_id.description: The unique ID# of the resource folder.

default_attributes.description: The default attributes of the campaign, if applicable (e.g., height, unit, width, x, y, z)

default_bundle_weight.description: Indicates the weight of the default [bundle](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/bundles.html).

default_category_id.description: The unique ID# of the [default category](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/categories-and-triggers.html) for the campaign.

default_fullscreen.description: Indicates whether or not the campaign will play in fullscreen.

default_interactivity_timeout.description: Indicates the timeout value, if the campaign is [interactive](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/interactive-campaigns.html).

default_interactivity_trigger_id.description: Indicates the unique ID# of the campaigns interactivity trigger, if applicable. See [Interactive Campaigns](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/interactive-campaigns.html).

default_secondary_sep_category_ids.description: The secondary [separation categories](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/categories-and-triggers.html) associated with the campaign, if applicable.

default_segment_category_id.description: The [segment category](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/categories-and-triggers.html) associated with the campaign, if applicable.

default_trigger_category_id.description: The [trigger category](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/categories-and-triggers.html) associated with the campaign, if applicable.

domain_id.description: The unique ID# of your domain.

goal_amount.description: Number of actions (i.e., impressions, interactions or repetitions) that, when reached, will terminate the playback of the campaign.

goal_unit.description:
Defines the type of action for the `goal_amount`:  
 0 = Repetitions  
 1 = Impressions  
 2 = Interactions

has_goal.description: Indicates whether or not the campaign has a goal.

id.description: The unique ID# of the resource.

pacing_period.description:
If you enabled [dynamic pacing](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/dynamic-pacing.html), the pacing period will be one of the following:  
* Plays per day  
* Plays per hour  
* Plays total

pacing_target.description: If you enabled [dynamic pacing](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/dynamic-pacing.html), set the pacing target using a `pacing_period`.

parent_id.description: The unique ID# of the [customer](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/customers.html) to which the campaign belongs.

state.description:
The updated state of the campaign or event:  
* 0 = Held  
* 1 = Contracted  
* 2 = Cancelled  
* 3 = Held-Cancelled  
* 4 = Goal reached

domain_id.description: The unique ID# of your domain.

parent_id.description: The unique ID# of the target resource.

type.description:
The criterion type. 
 **Note:** The values in the request are a bitmask of the values below: 
* All = 0x0 
* Display unit = 0x1 
* Skin (frame) = 0x2 
* Content (ad copy) = 0x4 
* Condition = 0x8

id.description: Description for property. ResourceId

post.description: Adds a [display unit](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/display-units.html) [criterion](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/criteria-and-conditions.html) into the targeting selection of your [media package](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/media-packages.html). As a result, [Broadsign Control Administrator](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/broadsign-control-administrator.html) users can create [campaigns](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/campaigns.html) from a template provided by your media package, that include your display unit criteria.

criteria_id.description: The unique ID# of the display unit criterion you want to add to your media package.

criteria_matching.description:
The manner in which your criterion will be used to match against display units. This falls in one of the three following categories:  
 1 = `OR`: Corresponds to Matching Any Of in the Broadsign Control Administrator GUI. The selected display units must contain at least one of the selected criteria.  
 2 = `AND`: Corresponds to Matching All Of in the Broadsign Control Administrator GUI. The selected display units must contain all of the selected criteria.  
 3 = `NOT`: Corresponds to Doesnt Match in the Broadsign Control Administrator GUI. If the display units match any of the criteria, BroadSign will not select them.

domain_id.description: The unique ID# of your domain.

parent_id.description: The unique ID# of your media package.

not_modified_since.description: Controls the age of the listed resource. Uses the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) combined time and date formatting. The earliest supported value is [Unix Time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time), or **1970-01-01T00:00:00**.

post.description: Adds a [frame](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/frames.html) [criterion](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/criteria-and-conditions.html) into the targeting selection of your [media package](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/media-packages.html). As a result, [Broadsign Control Administrator](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/broadsign-control-administrator.html) users can create [campaigns](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/campaigns.html) from a template provided by your media package, that include your display unit criteria.

criteria_id.description: The unique ID# of the frame criterion you want to add to your media package.

criteria_matching.description:
The manner in which your criterion will be used to match against frames. This falls in one of the three following categories:  
 1 = `OR`: Corresponds to Matching Any Of in the Broadsign Control Administrator GUI. The selected frames must contain at least one of the selected criteria.  
 2 = `AND`: Corresponds to Matching All Of in the Broadsign Control Administrator GUI. The selected frames must contain all of the selected criteria.  
 3 = `NOT`: Corresponds to Doesnt Match in the Broadsign Control Administrator GUI. If the frames match any of the criteria, BroadSign will not select them.

domain_id.description: The unique ID# of your domain.

parent_id.description: The unique ID# of your media package.

not_modified_since.description: Controls the age of the listed resource. Uses the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) combined time and date formatting. The earliest supported value is [Unix Time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time), or **1970-01-01T00:00:00**.

get.description:
Lists all instances during which the download of an [ad copy](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/ad-copies.html) took place. The download may be *from* BroadSign Server or an [edge server](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/edge-servers.html); it may be *to* a [player](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/players.html) or edge server.  
 **Note:** If you specify the optional `resource_id` parameter, you will only receive downloads to that player or edge server.

Lists all proactive [email notifications](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/email-notifications.html) on your domain. 
 An example of an occasion triggering a proactive notification is when you have booked a [campaign](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/campaigns.htmlbooking/) to start at a future date and time, but neglected to include a [schedule](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/schedules-campaign.html).

notification_type.description:
The type of notification:  
* 1 = Contacted  
* 2 = Unregistered  
* 3 = Display device error  
* 4 = Display not fullscreen  
* 5 = Playback error  
* 6 = Playback missing file  
* 7 = Playback truncated file  
* 8 = Playback disk space  
* 9 = MIA  
* 10 = Unexpected shutdown  
* 11 = Difficulties polling  
* 12 = Performance problem  
* 13 = Domain quota exceeded  
* 14 = Content uploaded  
* 15 = Content approved  
* 16 = Content deactivated  
* 17 = New reservation  
* 18 = Reservation promoted  
* 19 = Reservation cancelled  
* 20 = Content added to reservation  
* 21 = Content removed from reservation  
* 22 = Registration activated  
* 23 = Incident: Application fault  
* 24 = Memory exhausted  
* 25 = Deadlock  
* 26 = Offline during business hours  
* 27 = Resolution mismatch  
* 28 = URL sync failed  
* 29 = Incident: Display Temperature (warning)  
* 30 = Incident: Display Temperature (critical)  
* 31 = Incident: Playback expired file  
* 32 = Orientation mismatch  
* 33-57 = Incident: External  
* 58 = Campaign not ready  
* 59 = Backup master activated  
* 60 = No scheduled campaign  
* 1001 = Overlap prevention  
* 1002 = Duration alerts

screen_no.description: The number of screens associated with the frame.

width.description: The width of the frame, according to geometry type (i.e., in pixels or as percentage of screen width).

x.description: The x-coordinate of the frame, in relation to the full screen.

put.description:
Updates an existing `skin_slot` on your domain. A `skin_slot` is a link between a [loop slot](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/loop-policies.html) and a [frame](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/frames.html) which, in turn, sits in a [day part](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/day-parts.html).  
  _Note:_ If you have booked a campaign to a `skin_slot`, it is active.

get.description:
Lists the details of a specific `skin_slot` on your domain. A `skin_slot` is a link between a [loop slot](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/loop-policies.html) and a [frame](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/frames.html) which, in turn, sits in a [day part](https://broadsign.com/docs/broadsign-control/13-0/day-parts.html).
